string.text: One of the villagers following your army has come to sell fruits and flowers, her green dress emphasizing her bountiful curves. She smiles at you and curtsies politely as befits your station.
The girl blushes at your attention, thanking you for your kind compliment, and continues on her way.
You notice the flower girl in camp again, with the same green dress. She's busy chatting to a few of your soldiers, and doesn't seem to notice your attention.

You're politely interrupted by the girl in the green dress, who smiles and curtsies towards you, asking if you have need of any food or flowers today. She seems happy to chat, and comfortable in your presence.

The girl blushes brightly, her eyes widening, and apologizes; she is just a young maiden, and did not intend anything untoward. She turns to move away, but glances back, her eyes briefly flickering towards your groin, and swallows nervously before quickly scampering off.
Compliment her.

Purchase some of her wares.

Perhaps you'll see her again?

Order her not to bother you.
Perhaps she wants courting...
It seems there's been some issue with today's dinner, and several of your men have grown restless due to hunger.

A tired, haggard looking woman approaches, flashing you an eager smile. She tells you your enemies have begun to doubt their resolve, and she has brought details that may help the siege end sooner than expected. Your troops cheer at the news.
Your scouts return with news that they've procured additional supplies from the surrounding villages.
Your scouts return with news from the enemy camp: It seems they've somehow procured reinforcements. This may prove troublesome in the future...
Your scouts return with news from the enemy camp: It seems the enemy has somehow procured more supplies. This may prove troublesome in the future...
Your scouts report that some of your enemy's troops have deserted, tired of being on the losing side of a siege. They are in no condition to fight you, and beg for you to let them join your army.
Some of your scouts have returned; they bravely snuck their way into the enemy camp and freed a number of prisoners, prisoners who are only too happy to join your cause, should you allow it.

Refuse; you don't need more mouths to feed.

Have them killed for desertion.
You're exhausted from your march, and may need to make camp soon.
You see a cloud of ravens were seen heading east, and that they briefly blocked out the sun when doing so. An ill omen, to be sure.
News of a rival lord's tremendous victory in battle has reached you. The message tells of brutal killings and maimed corpses on the battlefield, sapping your nerve.
You receive word that one of your enemies has suffered a terrible defeat and been captured in battle. The good news puts a spring in your step. One less thing to worry about - for now.

You chance upon a huddled, filthy person on the road, and as you approach realize it's a bound man. He looks exhausted and famished, and explains that he's only just escaped captivity at the hands of some bandits. He begs you to help him get safely to the nearest town.
You find a group of ragged soldiers, deserters from a nearby army. They are in no condition to fight you, and beg for you to give them enough food to survive, a least for a few more days.
Continue your journey.
Help him up and bring him along.
Refuse; you've not enough food as it is.
Share some of your food.

He seems to be holding his own for now, but it's one against twelve, which seems rather poor odds, even for a master swordsman.
